frontmatter.title: Overuse of Rails engines
frontmatter.description: In this post, we will see how the overuse of engines could lead to some serious issues.

frontmatter.title: Rails for Multi database defines reading_request? in resolver
frontmatter.description: Rails moves reading_request? method from the DatabaseSelector to the DatabaseSelector::Resolver class so that we can override the method in custom Resolver.

frontmatter.title: Rails allows specifying the maximum number of records that will be destroyed in a single background job.
frontmatter.description: Rails adds an active record configuration to limit the maximum number of dependent records destroyed in a single background job.

frontmatter.title: Rails allows using aliased attributes with insert_all and upsert_all
frontmatter.description: Rails is continuously adding convenience to make active record queries more flexible. Now, Rails has added support to use aliased attributes with insert/upsert_all.

frontmatter.title: Know how to rollout and rollback deployments in Kubernetes
frontmatter.description: As people and businesses increasingly depend on SaaS products, DevOps have started on creating reliable infrastructure. Reducing deployment downtime is at the top of their priority list. In this post, we will see how Kubernetes handles this gracefully.

frontmatter.title: Ruby 3.1 introduces Variable Width Allocation for Strings
frontmatter.description: In this blog let us understand how Variable Width Allocation works in Ruby
